body.p: XLIFF (XML Localization Interchange File Format) is an XML-based format that was designed to standardize the way multilingual data is passed between tools during a localization process. provides the following support for editing XLIFF documents:

XLIFF 2.0 Support:
New file templates for XLIFF documents.
A default CSS file (xliff.css) used for rendering XLIFF content in Author mode is stored in /frameworks/xliff/css/.
Validation and content completion support using local catalogs. The default catalog (catalog.xml) for version 1.2 is stored in /frameworks/xliff/xsd/1.2, and for version 2.0 in /frameworks/xliff/xsd/2.0.

XLIFF Version 2.0 Enhanced Support:
Support for validating XLIFF 2.0 documents using modules. The default modules are stored in /frameworks/xliff/xsd/2.0/modules.
